value: Preschool Could Get $219 million in Extra Funding
California Department of Finance and Early Edge California

The state also increased funding for child care (not preschool) slots by $14 million for General Child Care and $3 million for the Alternative Payment Program for 1,500 more slots. In addition, the state increased funds for Early Start by $8 million and the California Black Infant program by $4 million. These two programs are for children ages 0-3 who are at risk of having developmental delays or disabilities.
